intro: Setcreasea lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf setcreasea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Setcreasea lanceolata thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
